title: Python for Machine Learning
why: The Python for Machine Learning exam tests foundational skills in essential Python libraries (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn) through practical questions focused on data manipulation, model building, and numerical computing - equipping beginners with the core toolkit needed to implement basic machine learning workflows while emphasizing real-world application over theoretical complexity

questions.question: What is NumPy primarily used for in Python?
Which Python library is used for data manipulation and analysis?
What does Scikit-learn provide for machine learning in Python?
options: Tools for model building and evaluation
questions.correctAnswer: Tools for model building and evaluation

questions.question: True or False: NumPy arrays are faster than Python lists for numerical operations.
Which Pandas data structure is used to store tabular data?
What is the purpose of the 'shape' attribute in NumPy?
options: To return the dimensions of an array
To calculate the mean of an array
questions.correctAnswer: To return the dimensions of an array

questions.question: Which Scikit-learn function is used to split data into training and testing sets?
True or False: Pandas can read data from CSV files.
What is the output of 'np.array([1, 2, 3]).sum()' in NumPy?
Which Pandas method is used to display the first few rows of a DataFrame?
What is the purpose of Scikit-learnâ€™s 'fit' method?
options: To train a machine learning model
questions.correctAnswer: To train a machine learning model

questions.question: True or False: NumPy can perform element-wise operations on arrays.
Scenario: You need to load a dataset from a CSV file for a machine learning task. Which library should you use?
Which of the following is a valid way to create a NumPy array?
Scenario: You want to predict house prices using a dataset. Which library provides the tools to build the model?
